business.headline: EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

Adani Green Energy exits Sri Lanka wind power deal; stock down 1%Adani Green Energy shares: As per the agreement with Sri Lanka, Adani Green was to construct two wind power projects in Mannar town and Pooneryn village, both located in the northern province of the country.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to end lower as IT stocks weigh in on stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 32.11 points to close at 76,138.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.85 points to end at 23,031.40.

Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

Explained: Why are large-cap mutual funds back in demandWith small-cap and mid-cap stocks experiencing corrections, investors are moving towards large-cap funds, which are considered safer and more stable in volatile times.

Quality Power IPO: 10 things investors must know before subscribing Quality Power Electrical Equipments Limited offers high-voltage electrical equipment and solutions for grid connectivity and energy transition.

New Income Tax Bill: How will it make taxpayers' lives simpler?The new income tax bill would be almost half of the current law, as the existing Income Tax Act,1961 contained 880 pages when it came into existence.
Sensex gains 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayAs of 10:48 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.85 points at 76,644.93, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 137.75 points to 23,183.00.

Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

New Income Tax Bill to be tabled today: Here's what you can expectNew Income Tax Bill is expected to come into effect on April 1, 2026. The bill aims to simplify tax laws, remove outdated provisions, and make compliance easier for taxpayers.

entertainment.headline: Not just Gujarat, all Samay Raina shows cancelled amid India's Got Latent rowSamay Raina's shows in India have been cancelled following controversy around India's Got Latent, with Gujarat shows being the first to be affected.

Singer Jonita Gandhi to perform at Lollapalooza India, will open for Shawn MendesJonita Gandhi will perform at Lollapalooza India on March 8, opening for Shawn Mendes. Her latest single Channa has also been nominated for a Juno Award.

Twilight star Taylor Lautner to return as werewolf in self-aware werewolf seriesTwilight star Taylor Lautner is returning to portray a werewolf in the self-aware Amazon series. Details of the show are yet to be revealed.

Anupamaa actor Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings at Maha KumbhActor Rupali Ganguly visited Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj with her family. She shared moments from her spiritual visit, including performing aarti, attending a hawan, and meeting a saint.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui begins Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in LucknowActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has begun Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in Lucknow. The actor will be seen sharing screen space with Chitragandha Singh.

Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

Jackson Wang makes a powerful comeback with High Alone from Magic Man 2Jackson Wang drops a new single, High Alone, that marks the beginning of his new album, MAGIC MAN 2. The album promises a deep dive into themes of identity and personal transformation, set against a backdrop of atmospheric production and introspective lyrics.

Actor John Lithgow approached to play Albus Dumbledore in Harry Potter seriesAward-winning American actor John Lithgow has reportedly been approached to play the iconic character of Hogwarts principal Albus Dumbledore in HBO's Harry Potter series.

Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter calls her 'evil step lady', issues clarificationRupali Ganguly's stepdaughter, Esha Verma, clarified her viral social media post against the actor. Esha requested privacy.

Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Jonas Brothers hint at big change for 2025, shocked fans ask, 'another breakup?'The Jonas Brothers shared a letter on social media that briefly sent fans into a panic. In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

general news.headline: PM Modi meets Elon Musk in Washington DC, billionaire's son X accompanies himPM Modi meets with billionaire Elon Musk in Washington DC, hours ahead of bilateral talks with Donald Trump

'Today is the big one': Trump to announce reciprocal tariffs at 11.30 pmAhead of his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi around 2.30 am (IST) on February 14, US President Donald Trump sparked speculation with his cryptic 'reciprocal tariffs' post.

PM Modi meets Elon Musk at Blair House in Washington DCPrime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Washington DC early on Wednesday on a two-day visit to hold high-stakes talks with US President Donald Trump in the face of concerns in India over Washington's new "America First" trade agenda as well as its policy on immigration. This will be the first bilateral talks between the two leaders after Trump assumed the presidency for a second term last month. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Jawan opens fire in Manipur camp, kills 2 colleagues before shooting himselfA CRPF jawan opened fire at a camp in Manipur. At least two jawans were killed in the incident while eight others sustained injuries.

Kerala's Rs 1,000-crore half-price scam: Victims explain how they got dupedIn one of the biggest scams in Kerala, a 26-year-old graduate duped 40,000 people across the state with a Ponzi-style network, offering scooters, mobiles, laptops and other household items at half their price. This is how Ananthu Krishnan pulled off the state-wide Rs 1,000-crore scam.

PM meets Elon Musk, talks with Trump to include tariffs, immigration Live Updates PM Modi, who landed in Washington DC on Thursday after a fruitful visit to France, has a jam-packed schedule that also includes a meeting with tech titan Elon Musk.

President's Rule imposed in Manipur days after Biren Singh's resignationManipur has been placed under President's Rule after the BJP failed to name a successor following the resignation of N Biren Singh as the Chief Minister.

2nd flight with Indians deported from US to land in Amritsar on Saturday: SourcesA second flight carrying Indians deported from the US is likely to land in Amritsar on February 15. Sources said that another flight carrying illegal Indian immigrants is likely to arrive after that.

What to do when your in-laws pressure you about kids - even in 2025It's 2025, but some people are still stuck with the idea that all married couples, whether they want kids or not, should have them. But with DINK (Dual Income, No Kids) couples at an all-time high, how can you tackle the family pressure with the utmost subtlety?

Bengaluru Metro fare reduced by up to 30% after backlash over hikeFollowing public backlash, BMRCL has revised the recent metro fare hike, reducing prices by up to 30 per cent. The board reviewed feedback and corrected abnormal fare increases, effective immediately.

Violence-hit Bangladesh Hindus sought safety at border, BSF sent them away: UNA fact-finding report from the United Nations Human Rights office corroborates reports that Hindus in Bangladesh were targeted in July and August last year. It also describes how India's Border Security Force (BSF) reportedly sent back 4,000 Hindus who had sought shelter near the border fearing for their lives.

DY Chandrachud counters BBCFormer Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud maintained that despite external pressures, the Supreme Court continues to uphold personal liberties and the rule of law, ensuring that judicial independence remains the cornerstone of India's democracy.

Kerala nursing college ragging video surfaces, shows victim tied, being torturedDisturbing footage from the Government Nursing College in Kottayam shows a junior student being tied up, stabbed with a compass, and tortured by seniors. Five third-year students were arrested after the victim and two others filed a police complaint detailing months of ragging.

Retired Berkeley professor drives Uber once a week, donates profits. Viral postIn a post on X, Sonith Sunku shared a picture of the Uber driver - Professor Paul – who studied at the Stanford University and earned a PhD in mathematics and economics at the age of 24.

What is India-Middle East-Europe Corridor and how will it benefit India?Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron reviewed the India-Middle East-Europe Corridor project on Wednesday in France and agreed to work on it together.

CBSE flags dummy school linked to JEE topper, says it was disaffiliatedAfter the success of a JEE (Mains) topper from a non-attending (dummy) school made headlines, CBSE released a notification stating that the same school had been disaffiliated last year.

UN report exposes Yunus on attacks on Hindus in BangladeshA UN report on human rights violations and abuses has debunked Muhammad Yunus' claims of "exaggerated propaganda" by confirming widespread violence against Hindus, their temples and businesses in post-Hasina Bangladesh. The report, conducted on the invitation of Yunus' interim government, details incidents of targeted mob attacks and arson.

Looking for a 5-star safety-rated car under Rs 10 lakh? We have you all coveredMany cars under Rs 10,00,000 (ex-showroom) now have safety features like six airbags, electronic stability control, brakeforce assist system, vehicle stability management, hill-start assist control and emergency stop signal, as standard.

Wife's love for another man without physical intimacy not adultery: High CourtJustice GS Ahluwalia ruled that emotional involvement alone does not constitute adultery, reaffirming that only proven physical relations justify denying maintenance under the law.

Champions Trophy: Shreyas Iyer's admission reveals India's think-tank problemWhy fix something that isn't broken? India seem to be overcomplicating their combination in the ODI series against England, which is a worrying sign ahead of the Champions Trophy. There appears to be a real problem of plenty for coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma. Why on earth did they leave out Shreyas Iyer for the series opener in Nagpur? An injury to Virat Kohli meant Shreyas got an opportunity after a late phone call from the skipper. The star batter revealed he was not in the XI as late as the eve of the match.

Rawalpindi Cricket StadiumThe Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium is one of the three venues in Pakistan hosting the Champions Trophy 2025. Established in 1992, the stadium has a seating capacity of 15,000.

Dubai International Cricket StadiumThe Dubai International Cricket Stadium, also known as the Ring Of Fire, will host all of India's matches during the Champions Trophy 2025 and also the semi-final. If India qualifies for the final, the match will be played in Dubai. The stadium has a capacity of 25,000.

Asia Team Championships: India lose 2-3 to Korea, but assured of quarters placeBadminton Asia Team Championships 2025: Men's singles player Sathish Kumar Karunakaran and the women's doubles pair of Gayatri Gopichand and Jolly Treesa helped India recover from 0-2 down, but they lost to South Korea 2-3 in the final group-stage tie. India booked their berth in the quarter-final.

Not pregnant: Healy clears air on Starc's Champions Trophy withdrawalMitchell Starc's wife and Australia women's team star, Alyssa Healy, has cleared the air regarding the pacer's decision to skip the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Starc had opted out of the tournament for personal reasons.

Kohli does not need captaincy to lead RCB: Bobat explains Patidar callRCB team director Mo Bobat assured that despite Rajat Patidar's captaincy appointment, Virat Kohli will continue to play a vital leadership role, offering invaluable experience and guidance to the team without needing the official title.

Virat Kohli's message to new RCB captain Rajat Patidar: You've earned thisVirat Kohli sent a heartfelt message to RCB's new captain Rajat Patidar and claimed that the MP batter earned the right to become the new skipper of the franchise. Patidar was announced as the new RCB captain on February 13.

IPL 2025: Rajat Patidar named new RCB captain, Virat Kohli backs callRoyal Challengers Bengaluru decided to name Rajat Patidar as their new captain for the IPL 2025 season. Patidar became RCB's 8th captain in their IPL history and replaced Faf du Plessis.

Liverpool's Slot, Jones shown red in chaotic Merseyside Derby vs EvertonLiverpool's Merseyside Derby against Everton ended in chaos with three red cards, a fiery brawl, and Arne Slot's ejection after a dramatic 2-2 draw, leaving tensions high despite Liverpool maintaining their Premier League lead.

Champions Trophy: Spencer Johnson hoping to replicate Mitchell Starc in PakistanChampions Trophy 2025: Australia's Spencer Johnson is hoping that he can replicate senior left-arm pacer Mitchell Starc's heroics during the upcoming Champions Trophy in Pakistan. Johnson has been picked as a replacement for Starc in the squad for the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
